title: Persist Global Settings to Config File
description:
Implement persistent global application settings storage.

Currently, AppSettings (font_size, show_minimap, allow_node_resize, language, current_max_entry_size) are in-memory only and reset on app close. This task adds configuration file persistence.

## Requirements

1. **Config File System**
   - Use dirs::config_dir() for platform-specific config location
   - Store settings in {config_dir}/rpa-studio/settings.json
   - Auto-create config directory if missing

2. **Settings Serialization**
   - Serialize AppSettings struct to JSON
   - Implement load_settings() function (returns AppSettings, fallback to defaults if missing)
   - Implement save_settings() function (called after settings dialog Apply)

3. **Integration Points**
   - Load settings during app initialization (before UI rendering)
   - Save settings when user clicks Apply in Settings dialog (main.rs line 515)
   - Update font size and locale on load (currently done at startup)

4. **Error Handling**
   - Log config file errors to console (not execution panel)
   - Gracefully fallback to default AppSettings if config is corrupted

## Files to Modify
- crates/rpa-studio/src/main.rs (AppSettings struct, initialization, settings dialog)
- Cargo.toml (add dirs crate dependency if needed)

## Notes
- This task is a prerequisite for 'Open Last Project on Startup' feature
- Keep settings global (not per-project)
- All strings use i18n t!() macro

Use names like 'exec, 'builder, 'val etc.

title: Fix bug: copy-pasting connected nodes between scenarios loses connections
description:
Fix copy-paste of nodes between scenarios: Connections between copied nodes are lost when pasting into a different scenario because the code only looks for connections in the destination scenario's connection list, not in the source scenario's list.

Solution: Extend the clipboard structure from `Vec<Node>` to also store the internal connections between copied nodes. When pasting, reconstruct these connections using the ID remapping table.

Implementation steps:
1. Create ClipboardData struct { nodes: Vec<Node>, connections: Vec<Connection> }
2. Replace clipboard: Vec<Node> with clipboard: ClipboardData in main.rs:112
3. Update copy_selected_nodes() (lines 1198-1208) to capture internal connections
4. Update paste logic (lines 1256-1264) to use clipboard.connections instead of scenario.connections
5. Update clipboard_empty checks to use .nodes.is_empty()
6. Test cross-scenario copy-paste preserves connections

Root cause: crates/rpa-studio/src/main.rs:1253-1264 filters connections from `get_current_scenario_mut()` which is the destination scenario, not the source.

Technical details:
- Clipboard currently only stores: `clipboard: Vec<Node>` (crates/rpa-studio/src/main.rs:112)
- Should also store: internal connections and their branch types
- Current ID remapping: crates/rpa-studio/src/main.rs:1232-1233 creates old_to_new_id HashMap
- This mapping can be reused to remap stored connections
- Connection struct: crates/rpa-core/src/node_graph.rs:573-591
- Scenario struct: crates/rpa-core/src/node_graph.rs contains connections Vec

title: Add missing documentation and crate-level docs
description: Add missing documentation: (1) Add crate-level doc comment to lib.rs (line 1), (2) Add missing_docs_in_private_items documentation for internal modules and items. This is lower priority - add basic docs only where critical for API users

title: Open Last Project on Startup
description:
Implement optional feature to automatically open the most recently opened project on startup.

## ⚠️ STRICT REQUIREMENT
**DO NOT ATTEMPT THIS TASK UNTIL 'Persist Global Settings to Config File' (rpa-0mt) IS CLOSED.**
This task depends on the config file infrastructure implemented in rpa-0mt.

## Requirements

1. **Settings Extension**
   - Add to AppSettings struct: open_last_project: bool (default false)
   - Add to AppSettings struct: last_project_path: Option<PathBuf>
   - Both fields persist via config file (rpa-0mt)

2. **Settings UI**
   - Add checkbox in Settings dialog: 'Open last project on startup'
   - Display current last project path (read-only text field or info label)
   - Checkbox toggles the setting

3. **Startup Logic**
   - During app initialization, after loading settings:
     - If open_last_project is true AND last_project_path exists as valid file
       - Load the project via open_project()
     - If open_last_project is true BUT file missing/deleted
       - Open blank project (default behavior)
       - Log ERROR to execution panel: 'Last project file not found: {path}. Opening blank project.'
     - If open_last_project is false
       - Open blank project (current behavior)

4. **Track Last Project**
   - Update last_project_path after successful project load (open_project())
   - Update last_project_path after successful project save (save_project_as())
   - Both require calling save_settings() to persist config

5. **Edge Cases**
   - First launch (no previous project): Opens blank project
   - Corrupted path in config: Treated as missing file
   - New project created and saved: Becomes the 'last project'
   - User manually opens different project: Updates last_project_path

## Files to Modify
- crates/rpa-studio/src/main.rs (AppSettings, RpaApp::default, open_project, save_project_as, Settings dialog UI)

## Logging Format
LogEntry {
    timestamp: '[hh:mm.ss]' (auto-generated),
    level: LogLevel::Error,
    activity: 'SYSTEM',
    message: 'Last project file not found: /path/to/file. Opening blank project.'
}

## Notes
- Reuse save_settings()/load_settings() from rpa-0mt
- Use dirs::config_dir() for config path consistency
- All UI strings use i18n t!() macro

title: Add Cut functionality (Ctrl+X) for nodes with connections
description:
Implement Cut operation that copies selected nodes and their internal connections, then deletes them. Should be available via: 1) Right-click context menu 2) Ctrl+X keybind. Should preserve connections between cut nodes when pasting.

⚠️ PREREQUISITE: Verify that issue rpa-90k is CLOSED before starting work. This task depends on the clipboard enhancement that rpa-90k implements.

Implementation steps (after rpa-90k is complete):
1. Add Cut variant to ContextMenuAction enum in crates/rpa-studio/src/ui.rs:12-18
2. Update canvas context menu (ui.rs:242-276) to show Cut button when nodes selected
3. Update node context menu (ui.rs:730-752) to show Cut button
4. Create cut_selected_nodes() function in main.rs that:
   - Calls copy_selected_nodes() to populate clipboard with nodes + connections
   - Gets selected node IDs
   - Removes those nodes from current scenario
   - Clears selection
5. Add Ctrl+X keybind handler in main.rs (lines 763-822)
6. Update handle_context_menu_action() to handle ContextMenuAction::Cut
7. Add localization strings: context_menu.cut in all locale files
8. Test: Cut single node, cut multiple connected nodes, cut and paste between scenarios

title: Fix missing localization keys in ru.yml and kz.yml
description:
Add missing localization keys and fix FIXME entries in Russian (crates/rpa-studio/locales/ru.yml) and Kazakh (crates/rpa-studio/locales/kz.yml) files.

Missing keys (3 total):
1. bottom_bar.clear - English value: "❎Clear"
2. variables.undefined - English value: "Undefined"
3. settings_dialog.log_entry_count - English value: "Max log entry count:"

FIXME entries requiring proper translation:

Russian (ru.yml) - 4 entries:
1. Line 27: activity_buttons.evaluate - has "+ Evaluate FIXME"
2. Line 40: activity_names.evaluate - has "Evaluate FIXME"
3. Line 60: properties.evaluate_expression - has "Expression: FIXME"
4. Line 129: system_messages.invalid_variable_value - duplicate entry with English text instead of Russian

Kazakh (kz.yml) - 3 entries:
1. Line 27: activity_buttons.evaluate - has "+ Evaluate FIXME"
2. Line 40: activity_names.evaluate - has "Evaluate FIXME"
3. Line 60: properties.evaluate_expression - has "Expression: FIXME"

After making changes, run 'cargo run --bin validate_locale' to verify all localization files are complete and consistent.

title: Convert canvas flow from horizontal to vertical with configurable direction
description:
## Complexity Level: Medium

This task requires changes across 2-3 core files with careful coordinate system transformations. The existing architecture is well-structured, making this feasible with focused effort.

---

## Problem
Currently the canvas uses horizontal left-to-right flow:
- Input pins on left edge (x=0, y=height/2)
- Output pins on right edge (x=width, y varies)
- Bezier connections curve horizontally with control offsets on X-axis
- New nodes are spaced horizontally based on X distance

This limits workflow readability for complex scenarios. Users need vertical top-to-bottom flow for better vertical screen usage and clearer step-by-step visualization.

## Solution
Add a compile-time constant `FLOW_DIRECTION` to toggle between Horizontal and Vertical layouts. All layout logic will be conditioned on this constant using match statements, allowing easy switching without runtime overhead.

### Pin Positioning Changes

**Input pins:**
- Horizontal: left-center (0.0, height/2)
- Vertical: top-center (width/2, 0.0)

**Output pins (default - single output):**
- Horizontal: right-center (width, height/2)
- Vertical: bottom-center (width/2, height)

**Output pins (dual outputs - control flow, error handling):**
- Horizontal: right-top (width, height/4) and right-bottom (width, 3×height/4)
- Vertical: bottom-left (width/4, height) and bottom-right (3×width/4, height)

**Error pins (always right-center, no exceptions):**
- Position: (width, height/2) regardless of flow direction
- Drawn separately, visually distinct from default pins

## Implementation Details

### Files to Modify (relative to repo root)

1. **crates/rpa-core/src/constants.rs**
   - Add FlowDirection enum (Horizontal, Vertical)
   - Add FLOW_DIRECTION constant to UiConstants (default: Vertical)
   - Lines: New (insert after line 3)

2. **crates/rpa-core/src/node_graph.rs**
   - Update get_input_pin_pos() [lines 375-377]
     - Horizontal: position + (0.0, height/2)
     - Vertical: position + (width/2, 0.0)
   
   - Update get_output_pin_pos() [lines 379-381]
     - Horizontal: position + (width, height/2)
     - Vertical: position + (width/2, height)
   
   - Update get_output_pin_pos_by_index(index) [lines 411-439]
     - Horizontal: right edge at height/4 and 3×height/4
     - Vertical: bottom edge at width/4 and 3×width/4
   
   - Consider adding get_error_pin_pos() method for right-center positioning
   
   - Use pattern: match UiConstants::FLOW_DIRECTION { ... }

3. **crates/rpa-studio/src/ui.rs** - Bezier Control Point Calculations (4 locations)
   
   **Location A: find_connection_near_point() [lines 145-148]**
   - Horizontal: distance = |end.x - start.x|; control1 = start + (offset, 0); control2 = end - (offset, 0)
   - Vertical: distance = |end.y - start.y|; control1 = start + (0, offset); control2 = end - (0, offset)
   
   **Location B: find_intersecting_connections() [lines 208-211]**
   - Same changes as Location A
   
   **Location C: draw_connection_transformed() [lines 1465-1468]**
   - Same changes as Location A
   
   **Location D: Connection preview during drag [lines 981-983]**
   - Same changes as Location A

4. **crates/rpa-studio/src/ui.rs** - Node Insertion Spacing [lines 823-836]
   - Horizontal: measure horizontal_distance on x-axis, expand nodes along x
   - Vertical: measure vertical_distance on y-axis, expand nodes along y
   - Change from: node.position.x adjustments
   - Change to: node.position.y adjustments

5. **crates/rpa-studio/src/ui.rs** - Pin Drawing in draw_node_transformed() [lines 1225-1427]
   
   **Input pin rendering [lines 1225-1237]**
   - Update text position offset from Vec2::new(12.0 * zoom, 0.0) to appropriate offset for new location
   
   **Output pin text labels [lines 1259-1427]**
   - All pin labels ("T", "F", "B", "N", "S", "E", "C") need repositioned
   - Horizontal: labels right of pins with +X offset
   - Vertical: labels above/below/left of pins with appropriate offsets
   
   **Error pin rendering (new)**
   - Always render on right side at (width, height/2)
   - Use label "E" or appropriate marker
   - Offset text right: Vec2::new(12.0 * zoom, 0.0)

### Implementation Pattern

Use consistent conditional throughout:

```rust
match UiConstants::FLOW_DIRECTION {
    FlowDirection::Horizontal => { /* current logic */ },
    FlowDirection::Vertical => { /* new logic */ },
}
```

This keeps both implementations visible and maintainable side-by-side.

## Testing Notes

- After implementation, toggle FLOW_DIRECTION between Horizontal and Vertical
- Verify pin positions change correctly in both directions
- Test connection drawing: Bezier curves should route perpendicular to flow
- Test node insertion: dragging nodes onto connections should space vertically (vertical mode)
- Verify error pins always appear on right edge
- Run cargo clippy and cargo build --release
- Test with complex scenarios (nested conditions, loops with error handlers)

## Related Notes

- No new data structures needed (constants-only approach)
- No user settings required (compile-time configuration)
- Manual node positioning maintained (no auto-layout)
- Both implementations coexist in code (easy to toggle)
- See BEZIER_CURVES_ANALYSIS.md for visual examples of connection routing
